page.title: 02THE MOORS OF THE PENNINES
page.content:
THE MOORS
There are 7 square kilometres of Extwistle Moor, which can only be described as inhospitable. A scenic minor road from Burnley to Halifax clips one corner, but this is now only used by local traffic and weekend motorists looking for good picnic spots and a little peace and quiet. The rest of the moorland contains only one footpath and one bridle track frequented by walkers, equestrians and rough riding motor-cyclists. The underlying rock is millstone grit and is covered with rough grass and heather on which a few hardy sheep graze.The whole moor is a catchment area for the seven reservoirs that circle it and is owned by the North West Water Authority.
